meanings.definition: The fact of having a right to something.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sense of entitlements to the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The entitlements to healthcare should be accessible to all citizens.
meanings.sent3: His entitlements to extra vacation days raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The entitlements to success must be earned through hard work.
meanings.sent5: The entitlements to happiness are different for each person.

meanings.definition: The amount to which a person has a right.
meanings.sent1: The company provided him with generous entitlements to paid leave.
meanings.sent2: She was grateful for the entitlements to financial support during tough times.
meanings.sent3: His entitlements to free snacks at work made him the envy of his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The entitlements to a fair trial are protected by the constitution.
meanings.sent5: The entitlements to a peaceful life should not be taken for granted.

meanings.definition: The belief that one is inherently deserving of privileges or special treatment.
meanings.sent1: Her entitlements to VIP treatment at the event made her feel important.
meanings.sent2: The entitlements to special discounts were a result of her loyalty to the store.
meanings.sent3: His entitlements to being first in line caused some eye-rolling among the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The entitlements to fame often come with a price of privacy.
meanings.sent5: The entitlements to luxury are not guaranteed and should be appreciated.
